channel.title: Who would host there website with a new upcoming host?
channel.description:
Me and a friend purchased a dedicated server, we are setting it up at the moment. But, we kinda want to know if we are going the right way with prices.
This host will be up Mid-December early January. We are professional hoster's , that split up from another hosting company and are now making our own.
We want the best prices people can find so we have came up with the following.
Package 1: $3 Disk Space: 2500 MB Bandwidth: 6000 MB
Package 2: $4 Disk Space: 6000 MB Bandwidth: 12000MB
Package 3: $5 (If we can't do it, you get your money back guaranteed + $5) Disk Space: Unlimited Bandwidth: Unlimited
All packages will also include: Guaranteed 99.9% Uptime 24/7 Support Daily Site Backups cPanel (Comes with all the pre configured scripts etc) Email Spam Filters Email Virus Protection Webmail Access IMAP Support Email Forwarders Email Auto Responders Email Box Trappers Unlimited Sub-Domains Unlimited POP-3 Email Accounts Unlimited Email Listings Unlimited MySQL Databases Unlimited PostgreSQL Databases Unlimited FTP Accounts ... and more
Any feedback would be nice. Such as what your looking for in a host, the price range your in and the things you need.

item.title: Who would host there website with a new upcoming host?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Starting up …, post:23, topic:318604”][quote author=ollie123 link=topic=415064.msg3056721#msg3056721 date=1260538980]
That’s a sexy server mopar. Tell me, what is the difference between Apache and Light-HTTPD?
[/quote]Lighttpd is less resource intensive as apache.[/quote]

Not just less resource intensive, but also much faster, and the configuration files are more robust. It runs much better than apache ever can, due to limitations of the design decisions.

[quote=“Starting up …, post:19, topic:318604”]@Mopar,
We have everything set up right we aren’t new to this. Also we have thought about going with a soft layer dedi with your specs. I didn’t put version numbers, but everything is up to date as we just installed everything not to long ago. Instead of lighttpd we are using apache though[/quote]

I use gigenet as a host, and don’t have many complaints with them so far.

As to version numbers though, I’m not talking about specific numbers. But ‘up to date’ doesn’t tell anyone anything. There is a latest version of apache 2 and of apache 1.3. There is a latest version of MySQL 3, 4, and 5, of PHP 4 and 5, of Python 2.5, 2.6, and 3. All of these versions are very different where software written for one won’t run on another, this stuff needs to be published before anyone will buy hosting from you.

Read full topic
item.source: Who would host there website with a new upcoming host?

item.source: Who would host there website with a new upcoming host?

item.title: Who would host there website with a new upcoming host?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Starting up …, post:7, topic:318604”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=415064.msg3055488#msg3055488 date=1260421449]
I don’t think this will follow through. A new company won’t be able to supply Unlimited bandwidth and disk space for only 5$ a month.
[/quote][quote author=Lin link=topic=415064.msg3055505#msg3055505 date=1260422245]

I don’t think this will follow through. A new company won’t be able to supply Unlimited bandwidth and disk space for only 5$ a month.

[/quote]We bought our dedi server from a top of the notch hoster, if we can’t supply it they can’t either.

I would say not enough information. What operating system? What software? What is the hardware like and the connections speed? Are you going to limit the number of accounts you put on a single server, or will you overload it? Are you setting up the web server in a secure fashion or will other people have access to my scripts because they are ran by the same user? (www-data probably)

A new upcoming web host is fine, but if you don’t have the answers to these questions and more or a plan to address all of the issues that inevitably come up with a web host, then you aren’t ready and you will fail. Good luck.

OS: CentOS
Software:
Php5
RoR
MySQL
PostgreSQL
Perl
Javascript
CGI-Bin
Zend Optimizer
Ioncube
Cron Jobs
Awstats
Webalizer
Sendmail
GD Library
ImageMagick
DirectoryProtection

Also, you may request other things to be installed.

Hardware:
Intel Xeon 3360
8 GB of RAM
2TB (can get more on request, we figured since we are small no point in paying for more until thats used up)
No SSH will be offered.

We will get the limit that we can out of that server and of course then set up another one.

Also, We scrapped up enough earnings to afford this dedi for about a year. So if all else fails we come out even.[/quote]

I don’t see any version numbers, also you don’t mention any web server software, though I assume you will have one running? Do you realize unless you set up something special that the web server will only run under one user and thereby allow anyone to access anyone else’s data and scripts if they write the code to do so.

Also, just for some comparison, the dedicated server that moparisthebest.com and moparisthebest.com is hosted on is about twice as powerful as your server. specs:
Quad core Intel Xeon E5410 @ 2.33GHz, 16 GB of RAM, running 64-bit Ubuntu Server 8.04 LTS with lighttpd 1.4.19, MySQL 5.0.51a-3ubuntu5.4, and PHP 5.2.4-2ubuntu5.7 with Suhosin-Patch 0.9.6. (with eAccelerator v0.9.5.3). PHP is ran as fast-cgi with lighttpd.

Read full topic
item.source: Who would host there website with a new upcoming host?

item.title: Who would host there website with a new upcoming host?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:15, topic:318604”]How are you going to provide 24/7 support? Can people call you at 2am and get you to fix host-related issues?[/quote]I shouldn’t have said 24/7, sorry.

We aren’t offering phone support quite yet, but maybe in the future.

We will offer Live support Mon-Friday 8-6
And 24/7 Email Support (We will check the support emails every couple of hours).

item.title: Who would host there website with a new upcoming host?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:13, topic:318604”]How do we know that this is real? You could be faking the money back guarantee ect, and just when you get our money stop contact with us. It seems like it could be a scam.[/quote] Anything on the internet COULD be a scam. But we are legit, See… We only do money transfer through Paypal. So if we did scam, you could easily get your money back.

[quote="`Alec, post:1, topic:318767"]Only one dedicated server?[/quote]We are using a powerful dedicated server, not a VPS. But once we get bigger we have a 16 core dedi on stand by.

Read full topic

Are you going to limit the number of accounts you put on a single server, or will you overload it? Are you setting up the web server in a secure fashion or will other people have access to my scripts because they are ran by the same user? (www-data probably)

A new upcoming web host is fine, but if you don’t have the answers to these questions and more or a plan to address all of the issues that inevitably come up with a web host, then you aren’t ready and you will fail. Good luck. :)[/quote]
OS: CentOS

Php5

Perl
Javascript
CGI-Bin
Zend Optimizer
Ioncube
Cron Jobs
Awstats
Webalizer
Sendmail
GD Library
ImageMagick

Also, you may request other things to be installed.

Hardware:
Intel Xeon 3360
8 GB of RAM
2TB (can get more on request, we figured since we are small no point in paying for more until thats used up)
No SSH will be offered.

We will get the limit that we can out of that server and of course then set up another one.

Also, We scrapped up enough earnings to afford this dedi for about a year. So if all else fails we come out even.
